oai_dc:dc.dc:title: United States Postal Service buttons
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The large button has an image of a horseman underneath is "P.O.D." which stands for Post Office Department. The back of the button is marked "F. F. HASSMAN/ BOSTON." This design was adopted in 1873 and stayed in use until 1893. The cuff button has olde English style letters "P.O." for Post Office. The reverse of the button is also marked HASSMAN. This design was used for vests and for the postal carrier hats. It too stayed in use until a new design was adopted in 1893.
